Derive Age Groups

Source: R/derive_vars_aage.R
derive_var_agegr_fda.Rd

Functions for deriving standardized age groups.

Usage

derive_var_agegr_fda(dataset, age_var, age_unit = NULL, new_var)

derive_var_agegr_ema(dataset, age_var, age_unit = NULL, new_var)

Arguments

dataset

Input dataset.

age_var

AGE variable.

age_unit

AGE unit variable.

The AGE unit variable is used to convert AGE to 'years' so that grouping can occur. This is only used when the age_var variable does not have a corresponding unit in the dataset.

Default: NULL

Permitted Values: 'years', 'months', 'weeks', 'days', 'hours', 'minutes', 'seconds'

new_var

New variable to be created.

Value

dataset with new column new_var of class factor.

Details

derive_var_agegr_fda() derives age groups according to FDA guidance. age_var will be split in categories: <18, 18-64, >=65.

derive_var_agegr_ema() derives age groups according to EMA guidance. age_var will be split into categories: 0-27 days (Newborns), 28 days to 23 months (Infants and Toddlers), 2-11 (Children), 12-17 (Adolescents), 18-64, 65-84, >=85.

Author

Ondrej Slama

Examples

library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(admiral.test)
data(admiral_dm)

admiral_dm %>%
  derive_var_agegr_fda(age_var = AGE, new_var = AGEGR1) %>%
  select(SUBJID, AGE, AGEGR1)
#> # A tibble: 306 x 3
#>    SUBJID   AGE AGEGR1
#>    <chr>  <dbl> <fct> 
#>  1 1015      63 18-64 
#>  2 1023      64 18-64 
#>  3 1028      71 >=65  
#>  4 1033      74 >=65  
#>  5 1034      77 >=65  
#>  6 1047      85 >=65  
#>  7 1057      59 18-64 
#>  8 1097      68 >=65  
#>  9 1111      81 >=65  
#> 10 1115      84 >=65  
#> # … with 296 more rows

data <- tibble::tribble(
  ~BRTHDT, ~RANDDT,
  lubridate::ymd("1984-09-06"), lubridate::ymd("2020-02-24")
)

data %>%
  derive_vars_aage(unit = "months") %>%
  derive_var_agegr_fda(AAGE, age_unit = NULL, AGEGR1)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 5
#>   BRTHDT     RANDDT      AAGE AAGEU  AGEGR1
#>   <date>     <date>     <dbl> <chr>  <fct> 
#> 1 1984-09-06 2020-02-24   425 MONTHS 18-64 

data.frame(AGE = 1:100) %>%
  derive_var_agegr_fda(age_var = AGE, age_unit = "years", new_var = AGEGR1)
#>     AGE AGEGR1
#> 1     1    <18
#> 2     2    <18
#> 3     3    <18
#> 4     4    <18

library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(admiral.test)
data(admiral_dm)

admiral_dm %>%
  derive_var_agegr_ema(age_var = AGE, new_var = AGEGR1) %>%
  select(SUBJID, AGE, AGEGR1)
#> # A tibble: 306 x 3
#>    SUBJID   AGE AGEGR1
#>    <chr>  <dbl> <fct> 
#>  1 1015      63 18-64 
#>  2 1023      64 18-64 
#>  3 1028      71 65-84 
#>  4 1033      74 65-84 
#>  5 1034      77 65-84 
#>  6 1047      85 >=85  
#>  7 1057      59 18-64 
#>  8 1097      68 65-84 
#>  9 1111      81 65-84 
#> 10 1115      84 65-84 
#> # … with 296 more rows
